Detailed Description

Native format for the persistent data of a Pokémon in Generation II.

This data is available both when the Pokémon is in the trainer's party or in the PC.

Field Documentation

◆ species

uint8_t pksav_gen2_pc_pokemon::species

Species index.

This value is the same whether or not the Pokémon is in an egg. If this is the case, the value is reflected in struct pksav_gen2_pokemon_party.species or struct pksav_gen2_pokemon_box.species.

◆ held_item

uint8_t pksav_gen2_pc_pokemon::held_item

Held item index.

When a Generation I Pokémon is traded into a Generation II game, the struct pksav_gen2_pc_pokemon.catch_rate field is placed here. As such, there is a set held uitem corresponding to each species when trading up.

◆ moves

uint8_t pksav_gen2_pc_pokemon::moves[PKSAV_GEN2_POKEMON_NUM_MOVES]

Indices for each of this Pokémon's moves.

◆ ot_id

uint16_t pksav_gen2_pc_pokemon::ot_id

The Pokémon's original trainer's ID (stored in big-endian).

This value should be accessed and set with pksav_bigendian16.

◆ exp

uint8_t pksav_gen2_pc_pokemon::exp[PKSAV_GEN2_POKEMON_EXPERIENCE_BUFFER_SIZE]

The Pokémon's current total experience points (stored in Base-256).

This value should be accessed with pksav_import_base256 (with a num_bytes value of 3) and set with pksav_export_base256.

◆ ev_hp

uint16_t pksav_gen2_pc_pokemon::ev_hp

The Pokémon's HP EV stat (stored in big-endian).

This value should be accessed and set with pksav_bigendian16.

◆ ev_atk

uint16_t pksav_gen2_pc_pokemon::ev_atk

The Pokémon's Attack EV stat (stored in big-endian).

This value should be accessed and set with pksav_bigendian16.

◆ ev_def

uint16_t pksav_gen2_pc_pokemon::ev_def

The Pokémon's Defense EV stat (stored in big-endian).

This value should be accessed and set with pksav_bigendian16.

◆ ev_spd

uint16_t pksav_gen2_pc_pokemon::ev_spd

The Pokémon's Speed EV stat (stored in big-endian).

This value should be accessed and set with pksav_bigendian16.

◆ ev_spcl

uint16_t pksav_gen2_pc_pokemon::ev_spcl

The Pokémon's Special EV stat (stored in big-endian).

The Special stat was removed in Generation II, but this field is kept in for compatibility with Generation I.

This value should be accessed and set with pksav_bigendian16.

◆ iv_data

uint16_t pksav_gen2_pc_pokemon::iv_data

The Pokémon's IV's, stored as a bitset.

These values should be accessed with ::pksav_get_gb_IV and set with pksav_set_gb_IV.

◆ move_pps

uint8_t pksav_gen2_pc_pokemon::move_pps[PKSAV_GEN2_POKEMON_NUM_MOVES]

The Pokémon's PPs and number of PP Ups used for each move.

Mask an index with ::PKSAV_GEN2_MOVE_PP_MASK to get the move PP.

Mask an index with ::PKSAV_GEN2_MOVE_PP_UP_MASK to get the number of PP Ups applied to the move.

◆ friendship

uint8_t pksav_gen2_pc_pokemon::friendship

A Pokémon's friendship/happiness value.

This value is used in certain in-game events and is used to determine the power of Return and Frustration.

◆ pokerus

uint8_t pksav_gen2_pc_pokemon::pokerus

The Pokémon's Pokérus strain and duration.

See <pksav/common/pokerus.h> for more details.

◆ caught_data

uint16_t pksav_gen2_pc_pokemon::caught_data

Data about where and when a Pokémon was caught.

The bitfield is arranged as follows:

  • 0-6: location caught
  • 7: 0 if original trainer is male, 1 if original trainer is female
  • 8-13: level caught
  • 14-15: time caught
    • 1: 4:00 AM - 9:59 AM
    • 2: 10:00 AM - 5:59 PM
    • 3: 6:00 PM - 3:59 AM

This data is only set in Crystal. Pokémon caught in Gold/Silver or traded up from Generation I will have this value set to 0.

◆ level

uint8_t pksav_gen2_pc_pokemon::level

The Pokémon's level.
